page.title: 11Recreation in Cliffe
page.content: Lots of children go to the{ {playing field}after tea. There are 6 swings, one seesaw, one rocking boat, a witch's hat and a climbing frame. There are tennis courts there and the Football and Cricket Clubs hold their matches there. These{clubs}use the{Village {Institute}at the crossroads in Cliffe: playgroup, mothers and toddlers, Youth Club, keep fit, Women's Institute, and Friendship Club and Silver Threads for old people. There is Bingo in the Institute on the last Tuesday in every month. St.Andrew's Mission Church, just outside the survey area, was rebuilt last year, and there is a Sunday School and a Girls' Brigade there. There is a small{playing field}in Osgodby, but only one club, the fishing club at the Wadkin Arms pub.
